page.title: 19CRAWLEY DOWN'S VILLAGE HALLS
page.content: Crawley Down's first{Village Hall}was built in{1890,}when the village {population}was about{700.}By{1970}the number of people had{doubled}and the need for an{extra hall}began to be realised. In{1979,}following a{public {meeting,}a committee was formed to raise money for another hall. The building of a{new junior school}left the old building available and, by {1983, Â£39000}had been raised to buy it. At the same time a{new pavilion was bought for the{Haven Sports Field. The{old school}was renovated at a cost of{Â£15000}and extended and furnished to accommodate a{social club}for a further{Â£35000.}The hall opened in {April 1984}and the Social Club later the same year. It was officially opened, as the{Crawley Down Community {Centre,}by the{Earl and Countess of {Chichester,}on{July 5th. 1985.
